articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia used hundreds of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles to attack western, southern and central Ukraine overnight, damaging homes and infrastructure and injuring at least six people, local authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: At least six wounded in large-scale Russian air attack on Ukraine, Ukrainian authorities say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military ordered Palestinians to evacuate areas in northern Gaza on Sunday before intensified fighting against Hamas, as U.S. President Donald Trump called for an end to the war amid renewed efforts to broker a ceasefire.
articles.title: Israel orders evacuations in northern Gaza as Trump calls for war to end

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday criticized Israel's prosecutors over an ongoing corruption trial against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, saying it was interfering with his ability to conduct talks with both Hamas and Iran.
articles.title: Trump slams Israel's prosecutors over Netanyahu corruption trial

articles.author: David Morgan, Nicole Johnson
articles.description: The measure, Trump's top legislative goal, passed its first procedural hurdle in a 51 to 49 vote, with two Republican senators voting against it.
articles.title: Trump's sweeping tax-cut, spending bill clears first US Senate hurdle

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people were killed and six injured in a stampede during a festival in eastern India on Sunday, officials said.
articles.title: Three killed, 6 injured in stampede at Indian chariot festival

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's attack on the Evin Prison in Iran's capital Tehran on June 23 killed 71 people, Iranian judiciary spokesperson Asghar Jahangir said on Sunday.
articles.title: Iran says 71 killed in Israeli strike on Evin Prison

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ugandan leader Yoweri Museveni has confirmed he intends to contest in next year's presidential election, potentially extending his rule in the east African country to nearly half a century.
articles.title: Ugandan leader Yoweri Museveni, 80, to seek reelection

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police said they were considering whether to launch an investigation after performers at Glastonbury Festival made anti-Israel comments during their shows.
articles.title: UK police studying Glastonbury performances after anti-Israel chants

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's League of Social Democrats said on Sunday that it would disband amid "immense political pressure" from a five year-long national security crackdown, leaving the China-ruled city with no formal pro-democracy opposition presence.
articles.title: Hong Kong's last active pro-democracy group says it will disband amid security crackdown

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: More than one-third of the people in the tiny Pacific nation of Tuvalu, which scientists predict will be submerged by rising seas, have applied for a landmark climate visa to migrate to Australia, according to official figures.
articles.title: Over a third of people on sinking Tuvalu seek Australia's climate visas
